column4: Hi everyone.  Problem with both 6.10 and 7.04:  If I have my wireless card in while the machine is booting, it locks up.  Also, as soon as I stick the wireless card in the machine (after booting), it locks up.
what's the chipset on your wireless card?
I'm not sure.  It's a netgear 16-bit b pcmcia card.
run 'tail -f /var/log/syslog' while you plug it in. Hopefully it will log some card information before it freezes.
OK - one second.
Nope.  Locks up before anything is written to syslog.
It takes only about 2 seconds after I plug it in to lock up.
have you got any other PCMCIA cards? It could be a problem with the slot rather than the network chipset
No, that is my only card.  I have two slots, though - should I try the other?
sure, why not
Ahah!  System still froze, but I got something in syslog.   Nothing bad, though - just that it is detected.
you could remove 'quiet splash' from the kernel lines in your /boot/grub/menu.lst to get a verbose bootup, then boot with the card in place
right now, it could still be a problem with the PCMCIA subsystem *or* the network chipset
you can edit the entries in the menu by hitting the 'e' key at the grub boot screen
unexpected IRQ trap at vector 50
sounds like you have PCI conflicts. Your BIOS setup may help.
Nothing in there to change mess with, actually.  I have serial and parallel turned off there.
I think you can manipulate the way the PCMCIA subsystem is initialized, blotting out address ranges etc. -- but that's beyond me... sorry
with kernel boot options, I mean
sudo ethtool eth0
speed:  1000MB/s.  Duple:  Full..  Port:  Twisted Pair.  Sweet :)  Thanks.
